biography:
Hollie Cook was born and bred in West London in a household dominated by music. She gravitated to the sounds of Marc Bolan, David Bowie and The Cure. With Sex Pistol Paul Cook as her dad, music was always around.

Entering professional acting, singing and modelling at a young age; Hollie soon rejected her performance arts schooling for a musical path truer to her influences. Family friend and The Slits singer Ari Up persuaded Hollie to sing backing vocals for a new EP Revenge Of The Killer Slits, which she followed by ditching school to join the band on a six week tour. Hollie was now an official Slit – Ari referred to Hollie as the ‘second singer’ – so when it came to record a new Slits album in LA, Hollie’s vocals, keyboards and even her song Cry all featured.

More collaborations followed: a duet with Jamie T on his Chaka Demus EP, with Ian Brown on The World Is Yours, and most significantly as featured vocalist on Mike Pellanconi/Prince Fatty’s underground reggae hit ‘Milk and Honey’. The single received airplay across BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, XFM, Kiss and even ended up on Grey’s Anatomy. Hollie jumped at the chance to get in the studio with Mike as she was smitten by the tracks she had heard. Hollie’s passion for reggae singers Janet Kay and Phyllis Dillon combined with classic 60s girl groups formed the basis for her new solo work of self coined tropical pop. The two have recently been locked in the studio recording her self-titled debut album scheduled for release on Mr Bongo Records in May 2011.

Hollie is currently lending her skills to The Rotten Hill Gang, a fluid crew set up by Gary Stonadge from Big Audio Dynamite II, who are on tour with a reformed Big Audio Dynamite in April.
name: Hollie Cook

theaudiodb.biography_en:
Hollie Cook was born and bred in West London in a household dominated by music. She gravitated to the sounds of Marc Bolan, David Bowie and The Cure. With Sex Pistol Paul Cook as her dad, music was always around.

Entering professional acting, singing and modelling at a young age; Hollie soon rejected her performance arts schooling for a musical path truer to her influences. Family friend and The Slits singer Ari Up persuaded Hollie to sing backing vocals for a new EP Revenge Of The Killer Slits, which she followed by ditching school to join the band on a six week tour. Hollie was now an official Slit – Ari referred to Hollie as the ‘second singer’ – so when it came to record a new Slits album in LA, Hollie’s vocals, keyboards and even her song Cry all featured.

More collaborations followed: a duet with Jamie T on his Chaka Demus EP, with Ian Brown on The World Is Yours, and most significantly as featured vocalist on Mike Pellanconi/Prince Fatty’s underground reggae hit ‘Milk and Honey’. The single received airplay across BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, XFM, Kiss and even ended up on Grey’s Anatomy. Hollie jumped at the chance to get in the studio with Mike as she was smitten by the tracks she had heard. Hollie’s passion for reggae singers Janet Kay and Phyllis Dillon combined with classic 60s girl groups formed the basis for her new solo work of self coined tropical pop. The two have recently been locked in the studio recording her self-titled debut album scheduled for release on Mr Bongo Records in May 2011.

Hollie is currently lending her skills to The Rotten Hill Gang, a fluid crew set up by Gary Stonadge from Big Audio Dynamite II, who are on tour with a reformed Big Audio Dynamite in April.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
Hollie Cook est née et a grandi dans l'ouest de Londres dans une famille dominée par la musique. Elle gravitait autour des sons de Marc Bolan, David Bowie et The Cure. Avec Sex Pistol Paul Cook comme père, la musique était toujours là.

Entrer dans le théâtre, le chant et le mannequinat professionnels à un jeune âge ; Hollie a rapidement rejeté sa formation en arts de la scène pour un chemin musical plus fidèle à ses influences. Ari Up, ami de la famille et chanteur de The Slits, a persuadé Hollie de chanter les chœurs pour un nouvel EP Revenge Of The Killer Slits, qu'elle a suivi en abandonnant l'école pour rejoindre le groupe lors d'une tournée de six semaines. Hollie était maintenant une Slit officielle – Ari appelait Hollie la « deuxième chanteuse » – donc quand il s'agissait d'enregistrer un nouvel album de Slits à Los Angeles, la voix, les claviers et même sa chanson Cry de Hollie étaient tous présents.

D'autres collaborations ont suivi: un duo avec Jamie T sur son EP Chaka Demus, avec Ian Brown sur The World Is Yours, et surtout en tant que chanteur vedette sur le hit reggae underground de Mike Pellaconi / Prince Fatty "Milk and Honey". Le single a été diffusé sur BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, XFM, Kiss et s'est même retrouvé sur Grey's Anatomy. Hollie a sauté sur l'occasion d'entrer en studio avec Mike alors qu'elle était frappée par les morceaux qu'elle avait entendus. La passion de Hollie pour les chanteuses de reggae Janet Kay et Phyllis Dillon combinées avec des groupes de filles classiques des années 60 ont formé la base de son nouveau travail solo de pop tropicale autoproclamée. Les deux ont récemment été enfermés dans le studio pour enregistrer son premier album éponyme dont la sortie est prévue sur Mr Bongo Records en mai 2011.

Hollie prête actuellement ses compétences à The Rotten Hill Gang, une équipe fluide mise en place par Gary Stonadge de Big Audio Dynamite II, qui est en tournée avec un Big Audio Dynamite réformé en avril.
theaudiodb.name: Hollie Cook

raw_data.profile: UK reggae vocalist. Born in 1986, she is the daughter of [a=Sex Pistols]' drummer [a250492] and [a=Jeni Cook] (who sang with [a=Culture Club]).

lastfm.bio_content: Hollie Cook, born 1987 in London, is a British reggae and pop singer plus keyboardist. With Sex Pistol Paul Cook as dad, music was always around. Entering professional acting, singing and modelling at a young age; Hollie soon rejected her performance arts schooling for a musical path truer to her influences. Family friend and The Slits singer Ari Up persuaded Hollie to sing backing vocals for a new EP Revenge of the Killer Slits, which she followed by ditching school to join the band on a six week tour. Hollie was now an official Slit – Ari referred to Hollie as the ‘second singer’ – so when it came to record a new Slits album in LA, Hollie’s vocals, keyboards and even her song Cry all featured. More collaborations followed: a duet with Jamie T on his Chaka Demus EP, with Ian Brown on The World Is Yours, and most significantly as featured vocalist on Mike Pellanconi/Prince Fatty’s underground reggae hit ‘Milk and Honey’. The single received airplay across BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, XFM, Kiss and even ended up on Grey’s Anatomy. Hollie jumped at the chance to get in the studio with Mike as she was smitten by the tracks she had heard. Hollie’s passion for reggae singers Janet Kay and Phyllis Dillon combined with classic 60s girl groups formed the basis for her new solo work of self coined tropical pop. The two have recently been locked in the studio recording her self-titled debut album scheduled for release on Mr Bongo Records in May 2011. Hollie is currently lending her skills to The Rotten Hill Gang, a fluid crew set up by Gary Stonadge from Big Audio Dynamite II, who are on tour with a reformed Big Audio Dynamite in April. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

Family friend and The Slits singer Ari Up persuaded Hollie to sing backing vocals for a new EP Revenge of the Killer Slits, which she followed by ditching school to join the band on a six week tour. lastfm.name: Hollie Cook

theaudiodb.biography_en:
Hollie Cook was born and bred in West London in a household dominated by music. She gravitated to the sounds of Marc Bolan, David Bowie and The Cure. With Sex Pistol Paul Cook as her dad, music was always around.

Entering professional acting, singing and modelling at a young age; Hollie soon rejected her performance arts schooling for a musical path truer to her influences. Family friend and The Slits singer Ari Up persuaded Hollie to sing backing vocals for a new EP Revenge Of The Killer Slits, which she followed by ditching school to join the band on a six week tour. Hollie was now an official Slit – Ari referred to Hollie as the ‘second singer’ – so when it came to record a new Slits album in LA, Hollie’s vocals, keyboards and even her song Cry all featured.

More collaborations followed: a duet with Jamie T on his Chaka Demus EP, with Ian Brown on The World Is Yours, and most significantly as featured vocalist on Mike Pellanconi/Prince Fatty’s underground reggae hit ‘Milk and Honey’. The single received airplay across BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, XFM, Kiss and even ended up on Grey’s Anatomy. Hollie jumped at the chance to get in the studio with Mike as she was smitten by the tracks she had heard. Hollie’s passion for reggae singers Janet Kay and Phyllis Dillon combined with classic 60s girl groups formed the basis for her new solo work of self coined tropical pop. The two have recently been locked in the studio recording her self-titled debut album scheduled for release on Mr Bongo Records in May 2011.

Hollie is currently lending her skills to The Rotten Hill Gang, a fluid crew set up by Gary Stonadge from Big Audio Dynamite II, who are on tour with a reformed Big Audio Dynamite in April.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
Hollie Cook est née et a grandi dans l'ouest de Londres dans une famille dominée par la musique. Elle gravitait autour des sons de Marc Bolan, David Bowie et The Cure. Avec Sex Pistol Paul Cook comme père, la musique était toujours là.

Entrer dans le théâtre, le chant et le mannequinat professionnels à un jeune âge ; Hollie a rapidement rejeté sa formation en arts de la scène pour un chemin musical plus fidèle à ses influences. Ari Up, ami de la famille et chanteur de The Slits, a persuadé Hollie de chanter les chœurs pour un nouvel EP Revenge Of The Killer Slits, qu'elle a suivi en abandonnant l'école pour rejoindre le groupe lors d'une tournée de six semaines. Hollie était maintenant une Slit officielle – Ari appelait Hollie la « deuxième chanteuse » – donc quand il s'agissait d'enregistrer un nouvel album de Slits à Los Angeles, la voix, les claviers et même sa chanson Cry de Hollie étaient tous présents.

D'autres collaborations ont suivi: un duo avec Jamie T sur son EP Chaka Demus, avec Ian Brown sur The World Is Yours, et surtout en tant que chanteur vedette sur le hit reggae underground de Mike Pellaconi / Prince Fatty "Milk and Honey". Le single a été diffusé sur BBC Radio 1, 6 Music, XFM, Kiss et s'est même retrouvé sur Grey's Anatomy. Hollie a sauté sur l'occasion d'entrer en studio avec Mike alors qu'elle était frappée par les morceaux qu'elle avait entendus. La passion de Hollie pour les chanteuses de reggae Janet Kay et Phyllis Dillon combinées avec des groupes de filles classiques des années 60 ont formé la base de son nouveau travail solo de pop tropicale autoproclamée. Les deux ont récemment été enfermés dans le studio pour enregistrer son premier album éponyme dont la sortie est prévue sur Mr Bongo Records en mai 2011.

Hollie prête actuellement ses compétences à The Rotten Hill Gang, une équipe fluide mise en place par Gary Stonadge de Big Audio Dynamite II, qui est en tournée avec un Big Audio Dynamite réformé en avril.
theaudiodb.name: Hollie Cook
